arch:property.oc:show_val: possibly disturbed (topsoil), although bricks from L72 wall are in situ in this zone, suggesting that the context is good, organic psuedomorphic residue with mudbrick debris found in the corner between wall and L78. after excavation, it appears the wall L79 extends for another course into this locus, and that there is a floor (traces in L91) we blew through at the bottom of the wall
mixed fill pebbles, organic pseudomorph and mudbrick debris

arch:note.arch:string: Contexts excavated in trenches were recorded using the "locus system." A locus is any discrete three-dimensional entity excavated in a trench. The key to the locus system is the recognition that a locus is any one thing. Differences in soil composition or texture are therefore as important as, for example, the difference between a pit and a wall. If two entities were distinct, they were considered separate loci and were therefore assigned separate locus numbers. It should also be noted that every context excavated in a trench was given a locus number and thus the trench itself is made up completely of excavated loci.

oc:metadata.dc:title: Kenan Tepe: Area E / Trench 2 / Locus 77 (Locus)
